summary: During the pandemic , federal agencies adapted their regulations to meet emergent needs. For example, agencies waived some eligibility requirements to expand access to food assistance programs. In our survey of 24 major agencies, most reported using these regulatory flexibilities more often than usual. Assessing flexibilities can help agencies understand successes or challenges. 15 agencies in our survey said they had finished assessing at least...
title: COVID-19: Agencies Increased Use of Some Regulatory Flexibilities and Are Taking Steps to Assess Them
